the contents are still a lot to improve and tons of bugs to be fixed. For current version, I think it's not friendly for a newbie(especially solo play and start with survivors), many players will DC(before start or in-game) just becuz they got caught, and of course some of the killers are camp killers which tremendously ruined the game experience for newbies. Some balance are not good enough yet.(include perks, items, rank system etc.) If u r a solo player, I truely recommend u start with killers, dat makes u quickly be familiar with the game mode, but if u got friends on ur back, just enjoy running n hiding the killers cuz I think it's more fun!

After 5 years of playing with 10,000 hours and constant up and downs, this game will always have a special place in my heart. I met a lot of great people because of this game and the game opened up a lot of opportunities for me, since I started becoming known on YouTube by creating content about this game. 

The game is far from perfect, there were and are questionable changes, disappointing Chapters BUT also on the other hand a lot of really fantastic chapters, changes and other stuff.

Many memories were created and will be created in the future.
Thank you BVHR.

Alright, I think it's about time I updated my review on this game and left some proper opinions and feedback. I've had this game since early 2017 and I have around 1450 hours, so it's safe to say that I've enjoyed my time in the game for the most part right? No one sinks that many hours into a game that they hate...except that most of the time I'm playing it...I do hate it. Sounds weird? Let me explain.

The Positives

- Really awesome map designs: They generally try to add a new map + variation or two alongside those with most new chapters they add to the game. This has slowed down recently, but this has been due to them updating the graphics and reworking the old maps. The new maps look pretty sweet.

- Cool Killers: I never feel let down by the new killers they keep adding to the game, this includes both original and crossover killers. The designs of the killers and their powers is fairly varied and leaves a lot of space to learn if you want to try out killer.

- Varied Survivors: There are a wide variety of different survivors, male/female and different ethnicities too which adds inclusivity which I personally love.

- Simple Gameplay: I don't think DBD is a difficult game to get the hang of. I think for the most part, it's pretty easy to learn what needs doing in a game. Being good at doing those tasks is a different thing but for the most part, it's an easy game to pick up.

And for me....that's where the positives end, so lets move on to the negatives....

The Negatives

- Match Making: Match making is hell. If I play killer, I get paired against survivors in purple or red ranks despite being a rank 20-19 leaving me unable to learn how to play killer better without being steam-rolled. Also, for some reasons lobbies take an obscene amount of time to get into for me as killer, despite being fast when I play survivor.

- Console Players: I'm sorry, but like adding console players to match making on pc was the worst thing they added to the game imo. The skill level between a purple/red rank survivor on console and on pc are just on a whole different level. I'm not saying they're bad at the game, but they just are no match for pc killers who often end up steam rolling up.

- New Animations: Hate the new animations. There was nothing wrong with them and they changed them for no reason??? They're not even an improvement on the old animations so idk why they needed to change them.

- New UI: The new UI makes the game look cheap and more so like a mobile game than a pc game.

- Camping/Slugging/Tunnelling: While all of these might be "valid" ways of winning a game but being on the other side of it...it just isn't fun. Who wants to be slugged and spend the entire game on the ground, or hooked and have to just sit there. We paid for a game where we now have to spend most of our time lying or hanging around because most killers are entitled and don't want us to have fun or be able to play the game at all. And it's not like this is a rare thing either, it's almost every single game, getting worse the higher rank you go.

I used to have big respect for the Dev team of this game. They used to really seem to give a shit, but now they just don't. They bring out PTB's to get feedback then ignore every ounce of feedback given and make changes in the game when we never even asked for them. Not to mention, making countless changes that didn't need to happen at all.

I once would have backed this game, supported it and recommended it, but I just can't do that in clear conscience anymore. Please do not buy this game and support it's development any further. Until the Dev team start listening to their community, it's not worth your time.

Oyun hakkında söylenecek çok bir şey yok oyun aslında çok güzel ve eğlenceli fakat bu da çerezlik olan oyunlardan biri neyse ki o kadar pahalı değil.

Oyundaki sorunlar, oyun artık eski popülerliğini yitirdi oyunu oynayan çok az kişi var oyunda lobi bulmak 10-20 dk sürdüğü oluyor ve oyunda çok az map ve çok az karakter var.

Kısaca oyundaki amaç, oyunda bi katil bide insan olabiliyoruz katil olduğumuzda oyun oldukça kolay yapmamız gereken insanları çeşitli özel güçlerimizle yakalayıp haritadaki askılara takmak ve ölmesini beklemek, insanın görevi ise oyunda bulunan 5 jeneratörü kapatıp (kapatmak biraz zor) çıkış kapılarını açmak ve katil gelmeden kurtulmak.

Oyundan bu zamana kadar aldığım bilgi bu kadar oyunu tavsiye etmem çünkü oynayamazsınız oyunda oyuncu yok.

4/10

Dead by daylight is a multiplayer team based game where 4 survivors try to outrun,hide,and escape from a relentless killer.As a survivor the main goal is to repair 5 generators to open up a gate where they can escape.As the killer the main goal is to slaughter all 4 survivors by putting them on meat hooks and sacrificing them to "The Entity".Each killer/Surivor has an in depth perk system and a leveling system.Survivors can use items like flashlights and medkits to their advantage while killers have a special skill like using bear traps or a chainsaw.Thats about it gameplay wise.The only downside to the game in my opinion is some of the players.Some can be a little toxic sometimes.

Overall I reccomend the game to fans of the horror genre.I give Dead by Daylight a 7/7

Juego entretenido por ambos lados : Sobreviviente y Asesino.

La dinámica del juego es mantenerte en tensión mientras corres y caminas por todo el mapa (que son varios y cambian aleatoriamente su distribución cada vez que empiezas un nuevo juego) 
Hay asesisnos campers como no los hay , eso no tiene nada de malo es parte del a diversidad de los tipos de jugadores. Lo que sí hace falta un mejor balance entre los mismos sobrevivientes y asesinos para hacer equilibrado el juego.

Jugar como sobreviviente es todo un reto y la base para hacerlo bien es la comunicación. Si tienes a un grupo de amigos y se ponene de sobrevivientes pueden utilizar comunicación por voz ya sea skype , teamspeak , etc ; o si no lo tienen tendrán que interpretar el rudimentario método de comunicación por señas que está por default en el mismo juego (limitado por cierto). Pero eso , a mi parecer, le añade más dificultad y más tensión al mismo juego.

Como asesino vas a tener que descubirir las difrentes características, ventajas  y desventajas de los diferentes asesinos que encuentras para elegir ya sea de forma gratuita o los que compras. El juego aquí es individual , vas a tener que crear una estrategia para hacer caer a todos los sobrevivientes en las trampas o explotar las fortalezas del asesisno que hayas elegido para colgar a los sobrevivientes en los ganchos y hacer que ninguno escape.

Buen juego de suspenso y survival.
